tourism.models module

class tourism.models.Activity(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Activity Model represents an activity that can be booked.

title

the short title describing the activity, limited to 200 characters.

Type:

CharField

description

the full description of the activity.

Type:

TextField

price

the per person price for the activity.

Type:

DecimalField

image

the filename of the image to be displayed. Images are stored in static/tour-uploads

Type:

CharField

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

booking_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

description

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

image

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
price

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

title

Type:

The number of people booked for

activity

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
total()[source]

Gets the total cost of the booking

The total cost is based on the activity.price and number_of_people :return: the total price of the booking

user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

tourism.urls module

tourism.views module

tourism.views.booking_confirm(request)[source]

Endpoint for creating a new booking of a guided tour.

Expects to receive an HTTP POST request. Creates a new Booking if the passed details are correct.

Parameters:

request – POST request with activity and number_of_people parameters.

Returns:

Redirect to the created booking if successful, otherwise renders the form with the error_message

tourism.views.history(request)[source]

Display history about Rwanda for users interested in visiting. :param request: the HTTP request. Does not require authentication. :return: renders the history page.

tourism.views.view_booking(request, booking_id)[source]

View the details of a booking.

Will only display the details to the user that created the booking. Other users will receive a 404 Not Found error. This is advisable for security reasons rather than returning a more meaningful response as it reduces the attack surface. :param request: the HTTP request with an authenticated user :param booking_id: the id of the booking to view :return: renders the booking confirmation if found and created by the requester, otherwise 404 Not Found
